title-group.article-title: Computer Model of Satellite Thermal Control System Using a Controlled Capillary Pumped Loop

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1993 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: A universal autonomous controlled heat transferring module on base of two-phase loop with capillary pump have been elaborated. This module consists of one evapourator and one radiator-condenser. Various variants for suggested module control by using of active or passive elements, providing the CPL start-up, restarting and temperature regulation, have been considered. There is determined a structure concept and recommendations on mathematical modeling of Thermal Control System (TCS), made on base of several controlled heat transferring modules with capillary pumps, are given. There are given results of computer experiment with mathematical model of artificial Earth satellite payload TCS. This TCS consists of four controlled, independent in power supply, CPL, which start-up and control are carried out by using of passive devices.

ref.mixed-citation: V. Ya. Sasiη, I.A. Zelenov, V. G. Zuev and E. Yu. Kotlyaro v, Mathematica! Model of a Capillary Loop Heat Pipe with a Condenser- Radiator, 20th Intersociety Con- ference on Environmental Systems, Williamsburg, Virginia, July, 9- 12, 1990 (SAE Technical Paper Series).
Yu.F.Maidavik et al., Development, Analytical and Expe- rimental Investigation of Loop Heat Pipe, Prep. 7th Int. Heat Pipe Conference, Minsk, USSR, 1990.

Yu.F.Maidanik, Yu.G.Fer- shtater, K.A.Goncharov, Capillary Pump Loop for the Systems of Thermal Regulation of Spacecraft, 4th European Symposium on Space Environmental and Control Systems, (ESA SP-324), p. 87-92, Florence, Italy, October 21-24, 1991.

Yu. F. Maidanik, Yu. G. Fershtater, V. G. Pastukhov, O. V. Zagar, Yu. M. Golovanoν, K.A.Goncharov, Development and Investigation of Two-Phase Loops with high pressure Capillary Pumps for Space Application, C-2, 8th Int. Heat Pipe Conference, Beijing, China, 1992.
